intro: Coussapoa purpusii, commonly known as the purple hibiscus, is a tropical shrub native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to deep purple. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and its stems are covered in fine, soft hairs. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in humid forest understories. The flowers are pollinated by insects and produce capsule fruits containing numerous seeds.
